parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a unique identification code "Cod unic de identificare: 11240060" at the bottom. While not explicitly labeled "CMF," its function aligns with the purpose of such codes, suggesting it's a form of electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions and promotes "Partidul REPER," a political party participating in the parliamentary elections.  It directs voters to choose "poziția 10" on the ballot, clearly identifying and promoting a specific candidate (party) in the election. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is designed to reach a broad audience, not just individuals. The use of hashtags like #parlamentare2024 further indicates an intention to reach a wide segment of the population interested in the parliamentary elections. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to support Partidul REPER in the parliamentary elections by explicitly instructing them to vote for position 10.  The language used ("Votează poziția 10," "SUSȚINE PARTIDUL REPER") is directly aimed at influencing voting behavior. This clearly satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It doesn't present objective information or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a single political party with a clear call to action, lacking the neutrality expected in journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a direct and overt campaign advertisement for a specific political party participating in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1289488752083021</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Atelierul de internet SRL, promotes Partidul REPER in the 2024 parliamentary elections.  The post explicitly instructs voters to select position 10 on the ballot, directly advocating for a specific party.  The use of a unique identification code, targeted advertising in Maramureș County, and the clear call to action ("Votează poziția 10," "SUSȚINE PARTIDUL REPER") all strongly suggest this is electoral propaganda. The post's objective is to influence voters' choices in the election, fulfilling all criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post's end date (1732953600) corresponds to December 1st, 2024, suggesting it was active after the official end of the electoral campaign period, further strengthening the case for a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Partidul REPER</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Atelierul de internet SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 1289488752083021) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează Partidul REPER pentru alegerile parlamentare din 1 Decembrie 2024, îndemnând direct alegătorii să voteze poziția 10 pe buletinul de vot. Postarea, cu un buget de 300-399 RON, a atins 25.000-30.000 de impresii, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea Partidului REPER.  Textul postării ("Votează poziția 10", "SUSȚINE PARTIDUL REPER ÎN PARLAMENT") și imaginea atașată constituie dovezi clare ale intenției de a influența votul, încălcând prevederile legale privind propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei legale. Contact: andrei@atelieru.ro, +40755080070, https://atelieru.ro/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
